benchmark_details.name: Named Entity Swapping for Metadata Anonymization
benchmark_details.overview: This work introduces an anonymization scheme for a corpus of texts to safeguard metadata from disclosure, specifically preventing large language models from identifying metadata associated with texts by using named entity swapping.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective is to provide an effective anonymization technique that can prevent metadata disclosure from correlated documents.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The method can only be applied to a fraction of text chunks in the corpus.

data.source: Earnings call transcripts from various companies.
data.annotation: Automated identification of named entities using spaCy.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated by evaluating swaps against pre-swap contingency tables.
methodology.interpretation: The balancing act between maintaining data utility and minimizing disclosure risk.
methodology.validation: Empirical analysis through predictive checks using state-of-the-art LLMs.

targeted_risks.harm: Reduction in metadata discovery rate by LLMs.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The method aims to anonymize data by preventing identification of named entities related to metadata.
